Sentencas: Mixed conducting perovskite-structured oxides are desirable catalysts toward the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) process.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Pure cubic perovskite-structured SrCoO3-delta is a promising class of mixed conductors with high ORR activity.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, it suffers from structural instability and thermal incompatibility at elevated temperatures, thereby impeding its practical application in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, A-site electron doping in SrCoO3-delta was conducted to chemically compensate for the loss of lattice oxygen, thus improving the structural stability of SrCoO3-delta.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Among the as-prepared Y-doped Sr1-xYxCoO3-delta (x = 0.05-0.20) samples, 10 mol% Y-doping of Sr0.9Y0.1CoO3-delta (SYC10) experimentally exhibits desirable electrical conductivity and lowest area specific resistance (ASR) while maintaining structural stability at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results are confirmed by first-principles calculations that involve density of states and oxygen vacancy formation energy.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 incorporation further improves the thermal compatibility and cell performance, where the measured thermal expansion coefficients between 30 degrees C and 1000 degrees C decrease from 23.3 x 10(-6) K-1 for SYC10 to 19.0 x 10(-6) K-1 for SYC10-40GDC, and the corresponding ASR5 with La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-delta electrolyte decrease from 0.080 Omega cm(2) to 0.044 Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C. Results suggest that SYC10-40GDC is a desirable cathode material for IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Synergistic electron doping and ion conductive phase incorporating of SrCoO3-δ as desirable cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
